events.name: Lithium resources and reserves in Quebec
events.wd_label: Lithium resources and reserves in Quebec
events.wd_description: The province of Quebec leads in lithium mineral reserves in Canada, with significant proven and probable reserves. These reserves are crucial for the production of lithium-ion batteries for electric vehicles (EVs).
events.description: The province of Quebec leads in lithium mineral reserves in Canada, with significant proven and probable reserves. These reserves are crucial for the production of lithium-ion batteries for electric vehicles (EVs).

events.name: Quebec's leading position in Canadian lithium reserves
events.wd_description: Quebec has 31.7 million tons of proven reserves with an average grade of 1.23% Li2O and 60.9 million tons of probable reserves with an average grade of 0.98% Li2O, representing the largest lithium reserves in Canada.
events.description: Quebec has 31.7 million tons of proven reserves with an average grade of 1.23% Li2O and 60.9 million tons of probable reserves with an average grade of 0.98% Li2O, representing the largest lithium reserves in Canada.

events.name: Proven reserves
events.wd_description: Quebec has 31.7 million tons of proven lithium reserves with an average grade of 1.23% Li2O.
events.description: Quebec has 31.7 million tons of proven lithium reserves with an average grade of 1.23% Li2O.

events.name: Probable reserves
events.wd_description: Quebec has 60.9 million tons of probable lithium reserves with an average grade of 0.98% Li2O.
events.description: Quebec has 60.9 million tons of probable lithium reserves with an average grade of 0.98% Li2O.

events.name: Lithium projects
events.wd_description: Quebec hosts several lithium projects, including the world-class Whabouchi project, which significantly contributes to the province's lithium reserves and resources.
events.description: Quebec hosts several lithium projects, including the world-class Whabouchi project, which significantly contributes to the province's lithium reserves and resources.

events.name: Whabouchi project significance
events.wd_description: The Whabouchi project is a world-class lithium-rich pegmatite deposit, representing 37.2% of Canada's mineral reserves and 22.4% of its mineral resources.
events.description: The Whabouchi project is a world-class lithium-rich pegmatite deposit, representing 37.2% of Canada's mineral reserves and 22.4% of its mineral resources.

events.name: Other projects
events.wd_description: Other lithium projects in Quebec also contribute significantly to the province's mineral reserves and resources.
events.description: Other lithium projects in Quebec also contribute significantly to the province's mineral reserves and resources.

events.name: Lithium processing
events.wd_description: Spodumene concentrate from Quebec's lithium projects must be processed into lithium carbonate or lithium hydroxide monohydrate for battery cathode production.
events.description: Spodumene concentrate from Quebec's lithium projects must be processed into lithium carbonate or lithium hydroxide monohydrate for battery cathode production.

events.name: Lithium carbonate and lithium hydroxide production
events.wd_description: Lithium carbonate, as planned for Quebec Lithium mine, is one of the compounds used for battery cathode production.
events.description: Lithium carbonate, as planned for Quebec Lithium mine, is one of the compounds used for battery cathode production.

events.name: Lithium hydroxide monohydrate
events.wd_description: Lithium hydroxide monohydrate, as planned for Whabouchi mine, is another compound used for battery cathode production.
events.description: Lithium hydroxide monohydrate, as planned for Whabouchi mine, is another compound used for battery cathode production.

events.name: Lithium demand for Quebec's EV fleet
events.wd_label: Lithium demand for Quebec's EV fleet
events.wd_description: Assessing the potential demand for lithium for Quebec's EV fleet involves considering the average amount of lithium in a car Li-ion battery and the projected annual number of new EV sales.
events.description: Assessing the potential demand for lithium for Quebec's EV fleet involves considering the average amount of lithium in a car Li-ion battery and the projected annual number of new EV sales.

events.name: Lithium consumption for EV batteries
events.wd_description: The amount of lithium required per kWh of battery is fundamental for quantifying market demand for EVs, varying based on the battery's chemical system and cathode composition.
events.description: The amount of lithium required per kWh of battery is fundamental for quantifying market demand for EVs, varying based on the battery's chemical system and cathode composition.

events.name: Quebec EV fleet growth
events.wd_description: The annual growth rate of Quebec's EV fleet is around 57%, with different types of electrically powered vehicles contributing to this increase.
events.description: The annual growth rate of Quebec's EV fleet is around 57%, with different types of electrically powered vehicles contributing to this increase.

events.name: Hybrid electric vehicles
events.wd_description: Hybrid electric vehicles (HEVs) use two power sources and contribute to the overall growth of Quebec's EV fleet.
events.description: Hybrid electric vehicles (HEVs) use two power sources and contribute to the overall growth of Quebec's EV fleet.

events.name: Plug-in hybrid electric vehicles
events.wd_description: Plug-in hybrid electric vehicles (PHEVs) are recharged by plugging into the electrical grid and contribute to the growth of Quebec's EV fleet.
events.description: Plug-in hybrid electric vehicles (PHEVs) are recharged by plugging into the electrical grid and contribute to the growth of Quebec's EV fleet.

events.name: Electric vehicles
events.wd_description: Electric vehicles (EVs) are powered entirely by batteries and an electric powertrain, significantly contributing to Quebec's EV fleet growth.
events.description: Electric vehicles (EVs) are powered entirely by batteries and an electric powertrain, significantly contributing to Quebec's EV fleet growth.

events.name: Future prospects and challenges for Quebec's lithium industry
events.wd_label: Future prospects and challenges for Quebec's lithium industry
events.wd_description: Quebec's lithium resources are sufficient to meet the provincial demand for lithium for EVs over a 33-to-58-year horizon. The province has the potential to become a producer and exporter of lithium-ion batteries, leveraging its proximity to the American and Ontario automobile industries.
events.description: Quebec's lithium resources are sufficient to meet the provincial demand for lithium for EVs over a 33-to-58-year horizon. The province has the potential to become a producer and exporter of lithium-ion batteries, leveraging its proximity to the American and Ontario automobile industries.

events.name: Local production GHG emissions savings
events.wd_description: Quebec has the potential to add value to its local lithium production by becoming a producer and exporter of lithium-ion batteries for EVs.
events.description: Quebec has the potential to add value to its local lithium production by becoming a producer and exporter of lithium-ion batteries for EVs.

events.name: GHG emissions from Quebec's ICEV fleet vs. lithium-ion battery production
events.wd_description: Producing lithium-ion batteries in Quebec would result in lower GHG emissions due to the province's low-emission electricity grid.
events.description: Producing lithium-ion batteries in Quebec would result in lower GHG emissions due to the province's low-emission electricity grid.

events.name: Economic and engineering challenges for local production
events.wd_description: Despite environmental benefits, the profitability and competitivity of local lithium battery production in Quebec will depend on overcoming economic and engineering challenges.
events.description: Despite environmental benefits, the profitability and competitivity of local lithium battery production in Quebec will depend on overcoming economic and engineering challenges.

events.name: Factors influencing lithium consumption for EV batteries
events.description: The amount of lithium required per kWh of battery varies based on the cell chemistry and metal content, which are proprietary and confidential.

events.name: Annual growth rate of Quebec EV fleet
events.description: The annualized growth rate of EVs in Quebec was around 57% in recent years.

events.name: potential of Quebec as a lithium ion battery producer and exporter
events.description: Quebec has the potential to become a producer and exporter of lithium-ion batteries for EVs, leveraging proximity to the American and Ontario automobile industry.
